graph_title: Number of countries making progress in ratifying, accepting and implementing through legal, policy and institutional frameworks, ocean-related instruments that implement international law, as reflected in the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea, for the conservation and sustainable use of the oceans and their resources
indicator_name: Number of countries making progress in ratifying, accepting and implementing through legal, policy and institutional frameworks, ocean-related instruments that implement international law, as reflected in the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea, for the conservation and sustainable use of the oceans and their resources
SDG_GOAL: Goal 14: Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development
SDG_TARGET: Target 14.c: Enhance the conservation and sustainable use of oceans and their resources by implementing international law as reflected in the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea, which provides the legal framework for the conservation and sustainable use of oceans and their resources, as recalled in paragraph 158 of “The future we want”
SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 14.c.1: Number of countries making progress in ratifying, accepting and implementing through legal, policy and institutional frameworks, ocean-related instruments that implement international law, as reflected in the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea, for the conservation and sustainable use of the oceans and their resources
STAT_CONC_DEF: Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) indicator 14.c.1 measures the number of countries making progress in the ratification of, accession to and implementation of ocean-related instruments that implement international law, as reflected in the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea (UNCLOS), for the conservation and sustainable use of the oceans and their resources.
SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 14: Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development
SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 14.c: Enhance the conservation and sustainable use of oceans and their resources by implementing international law as reflected in the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea, which provides the legal framework for the conservation and sustainable use of oceans and their resources, as recalled in paragraph 158 of “The future we want”
SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicator 14.c.1: Number of countries making progress in ratifying, accepting and implementing through legal, policy and institutional frameworks, ocean-related instruments that implement international law, as reflected in the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea, for the conservation and sustainable use of the oceans and their resources
un_custodian_agency: Division for Ocean Affairs and the Law of the Sea (UN-DOALOS), Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO), UN Environment (UNEP), International Labour Organization (ILO), other UN-Oceans agencies
goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata (PDF 4.0 MB)

fr.SDG_GOAL: Objectif 14: Conserver et exploiter de manière durable les océans, les mers et les ressources marines aux fins du développement durable
fr.SDG_TARGET:
Cible 14.c : Améliorer la conservation et l’utilisation durable des océans et de leurs ressources en application des dispositions du droit international, 
énoncées dans la Convention des Nations Unies sur le droit de la mer, qui fournit le cadre juridique requis pour la conservation et l’utilisation durable des océans 
et de leurs ressources, comme il est rappelé au paragraphe 158 de « L’avenir que nous voulons »
fr.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicateur 14.c.1 : Nombre de pays progressant dans la ratification, l’acceptation et la mise en œuvre, au moyen de cadres juridiques, opérationnels et institutionnels, des instruments relatifs aux océans visant à donner effet aux dispositions du droit international énoncées dans la Convention des Nations Unies sur le droit de la mer qui concernent la conservation et de l’utilisation durable des océans et de leurs ressources
fr.SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Objectif 14: Conserver et exploiter de manière durable les océans, les mers et les ressources marines aux fins du développement durable
fr.SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL:
Cible 14.c : Améliorer la conservation et l’utilisation durable des océans et de leurs ressources en application des dispositions du droit international, 
énoncées dans la Convention des Nations Unies sur le droit de la mer, qui fournit le cadre juridique requis pour la conservation et l’utilisation durable des océans 
et de leurs ressources, comme il est rappelé au paragraphe 158 de « L’avenir que nous voulons »
fr.SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicateur 14.c.1 : Nombre de pays progressant dans la ratification, l’acceptation et la mise en œuvre, au moyen de cadres juridiques, opérationnels et institutionnels, des instruments relatifs aux océans visant à donner effet aux dispositions du droit international énoncées dans la Convention des Nations Unies sur le droit de la mer qui concernent la conservation et de l’utilisation durable des océans et de leurs ressources
fr.un_custodian_agency: Division des affaires maritimes et du droit de la mer (UN-DOALOS), Organisation des Nations Unies pour l'alimentation et l'agriculture (FAO), le Programme des Nations Unies pour l'environnement (PNUE), Organisation internationale du Travail (OIT), autres organismes d’ONU-Océans
fr.goal_meta_link_text: Métadonnées des objectifs de développement durable des Nations Unies
